kWL

Class Representation

  • java.lang.Object
    • kWL.Representation

  • public class Representation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that provides static methods to deal with permutations given in cyclic format as a String. The String format used is the format GAP uses when representing permutations. Also contains a method to format and print a permutation instance.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Representation() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static Permutation parsePermutation(java.lang.String s, int degree)
      Parses a String given in the GAP format to a Permutation instance.
      static Permutation parsePermutation(java.lang.String s, int start, int end, int degree)
      Same method as the above, except gets the start and end indices of where to parse in the String, as in, it ignores everything not in the interval [start, end).
      static void printCyclic(Permutation p)
      Formats a permutation to the GAP format and prints it.

    • Method Detail

      • parsePermutation

        public static Permutation parsePermutation(java.lang.String s,
                                           int degree)
                                    throws InvalidPermutationException
        Parses a String given in the GAP format to a Permutation instance. Degree of the String must be given, and must be able to cover all the integers appearing in the Permutation.
        Parameters:
        s - the String to parse
        degree - the degree of the permutation Permutation should be given in Cyclic format "(x1,x2,x3)(y1,y2,y3,y4)" where x1, x2, y1, ... are integers. Any amount of spaces or tab spaces anywhere is allowed. Any integer should appear at most once and should be in the interval [1, degree].
        Throws:
        InvalidPermutationException

      • parsePermutation

        public static Permutation parsePermutation(java.lang.String s,
                                           int start,
                                           int end,
                                           int degree)
                                    throws InvalidPermutationException
        Same method as the above, except gets the start and end indices of where to parse in the String, as in, it ignores everything not in the interval [start, end).
        Parameters:
        s - the String to parse
        degree - the degree of the permutation
        start - start index
        end - end index
        Throws:
        InvalidPermutationException

      • printCyclic

        public static void printCyclic(Permutation p)
        Formats a permutation to the GAP format and prints it.
        Parameters:
        p - the permutation instance
